parts.text: {"word":"reworking","priority":"★★☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"手直し、再加工、修正","english_definition":"The act of revising or improving something; the process of making changes or improvements to something that has already been made or done.","examples":[{"sentence":"The design team is currently reworking the website's layout.","translation":"デザインチームは現在、ウェブサイトのレイアウトを手直ししています。"},{"sentence":"The author spent months reworking the manuscript before submitting it to the publisher.","translation":"著者は出版社に原稿を提出する前に、数ヶ月かけて原稿を修正しました。"},{"sentence":"The company is reworking its marketing strategy to target a younger demographic.","translation":"会社は、より若い層をターゲットにするために、マーケティング戦略を再構築しています。"}],"collocations":["reworking a design (デザインの手直し)","reworking a manuscript (原稿の修正)","reworking a strategy (戦略の再構築)","reworking a plan (計画の練り直し)","reworking code (コードの修正)"],"synonyms":["revision","modification","improvement","alteration","remodeling","refinement","reconstruction"],"antonyms":["preservation","retention","maintenance"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","definition":"(動詞の現在分詞)手直しする、再加工する、修正する","english_definition":"Present participle of the verb \"rework\": to revise or improve something.","examples":[{"sentence":"They are reworking the software to fix the bugs.","translation":"彼らはバグを修正するためにソフトウェアを手直ししています。"},{"sentence":"She is reworking her presentation to make it more engaging.","translation":"彼女はプレゼンテーションをより魅力的にするために修正しています。"},{"sentence":"The artist is reworking the sculpture to add more detail.","translation":"アーティストは、より詳細を加えるために彫刻を再加工しています。"}],"collocations":["reworking code (コードを手直しする)","reworking a presentation (プレゼンテーションを修正する)","reworking a document (文書を修正する)","reworking a project (プロジェクトを再検討する)"],"synonyms":["revising","modifying","improving","altering","remodeling","refining","reconstructing"],"antonyms":["preserving","retaining","maintaining"]}],"etymology":{"value":"Derived from the verb \"rework,\" which combines the prefix \"re-\" (meaning again or anew) with the verb \"work\" (meaning to perform a task or activity). Therefore, \"reworking\" literally means to work again or to work something over.","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ˌriːˈwɜːrkɪŋ/","syllables":"re-work-ing"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_participle":"reworking"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"\"Reworking\" implies a process of improvement or correction. It suggests that something was already created or done, but it needs to be revised or modified to meet certain standards or goals. It is commonly used in contexts such as design, writing, software development, and manufacturing. The term emphasizes the iterative nature of the process, highlighting that the task involves going back and making changes to something that already exists.","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ The reworking was done quick.","correct":"✓ The reworking was done quickly.","note":"\"Quick\" is an adjective, while \"quickly\" is an adverb. Since it modifies the verb \"was done,\" the adverb form is needed."},{"incorrect":"✗ We are re-working the plan, but it's still the same.","correct":"✓ We are reworking the plan to make it better.","note":"\"Reworking\" implies that there will be changes or improvements. If the plan remains the same, then \"reworking\" is not the appropriate term."},{"incorrect":"✗ The reworking of the car engine was very expensively.","correct":"✓ The reworking of the car engine was very expensive.","note":"\"Expensive\" is an adjective, while \"expensively\" is an adverb. In this context, \"expensive\" is needed to describe the cost of the reworking."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["rework (verb, noun)","reworked (adjective)"],"phrasal_verbs":[],"related_nouns":["rework","revision","modification","improvement"],"related_verbs":["revise","modify","improve","alter","remodel","refine","reconstruct"],"priority":"★★★"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B2","frequency_google_ngram":"Relatively low frequency, but common in specific contexts (e.g., design, software development).","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B2","text":"The word \"reworking\" means to revise or improve something that has already been made or done. It's used when you need to make changes or corrections to something to make it better. This word is common in professional settings, such as design, writing, and software development, where projects often require multiple revisions to achieve the desired outcome. It implies a process of going back and making changes to refine the work.","example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The team is **reworking** the marketing campaign based on customer feedback.","translation":"チームは顧客からのフィードバックに基づいてマーケティングキャンペーンを再構築しています。","type":"verb (present participle)","meaning_category":"修正する"},{"sentence":"The **reworking** of the engine improved its performance significantly.","translation":"エンジンの手直しにより、性能が大幅に向上しました。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"手直し"},{"sentence":"The artist spent weeks **reworking** the painting to achieve the desired effect.","translation":"アーティストは、望ましい効果を得るために、数週間かけて絵画を再加工しました。","type":"verb (present participle)","meaning_category":"再加工する"},{"sentence":"The **reworking** process involved several stages of testing and refinement.","translation":"再加工のプロセスには、いくつかの段階のテストと改良が含まれていました。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"修正"}]}
